link.name: Pathfinder #200: Seven Dooms for Sandpoint pg. 89
link.alt: Pathfinder #200: Seven Dooms for Sandpoint pg. 89

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Medium
traits.text: *Space:* 5 feet, *Reach (Tall):* 5 feet, *Reach (Long):* 5 feet

traits.name: Grioth
traits.text: A grioth is a batlike alien that wields occult powers and can exist in the dark vacuum of space. They have darkvision and echolocation.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

link.name: Pathfinder #200: Seven Dooms for Sandpoint pg. 89
link.alt: Pathfinder #200: Seven Dooms for Sandpoint pg. 89

universal_monster_ability.name: Telepathy
universal_monster_ability.text: A monster with telepathy can communicate mentally with any creatures within the listed radius, as long as they share a language. This doesn't give any special access to their thoughts and communicates no more information than normal speech would.

traits.name: Aura
traits.text: An aura is an emanation that continually ebbs out from you, affecting creatures within a certain radius. Aura can also refer to the magical signature of an item.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

interaction_abilities.name: Echolocation
interaction_abilities.text: A grioth can use its hearing as a precise sense at the listed range.

automatic_abilities.name: Light Blindness
automatic_abilities.text: No Breath A grioth doesn't breathe except to speak and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as an inhaled poison).

universal_monster_ability.name: Light Blindness
universal_monster_ability.text: When first exposed to bright light, the monster is blinded until the end of its next turn. After this exposure, light doesn't blind the monster again until after it spends 1 hour in darkness. However, as long as the monster is in an area of bright light, it's dazzled.

traits.name: Shove
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Shove with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand. This uses the weapon’s reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Shove using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

ability.name: Grim Curse of Azathoth

traits.name: Curse
traits.text: A curse is an effect that places some long-term affliction on a creature. Curses are always magical and are typically the result of a spell or trap. Effects with this trait can be removed only by effects that specifically target curses.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text:
This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to divine magic.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature’s emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Enchantment
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

ability.effect: Ziradini invokes Azathoth's name in Aklo as he stares at a creature he can see within 30 feet. His eyes glow orange, and the target endures a brief vision of the seething chaos that churns at the center of the Material Plane and, for that instant, beholds their own insignificance in the cosmos. The target must attempt a DC 26 Will save.
ability.success: The creature becomes stupefied 1 for 1 hour.
ability.failure: The creature becomes stupefied 1, and the first time each night they gaze upon the night sky, they must make a DC 26 Will save or they increase the value of their stupefied condition by 1 (to a maximum of stupefied 4, or they become stupefied 1 if they do not have this condition). Even if the stupefied condition is removed, the target must continue to save upon gazing upon the night sky once per night until the curse is removed.
ability.critical_failure: As failure, but the target feels the weight of the cosmos when the sun sets on their homeland, wherever they may be in the Material Plane or the Great Beyond—they need not gaze upon the night sky.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature’s emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Fear
traits.text: Fear effects evoke the emotion of fear. Effects with this trait always have the mental and emotion traits as well.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Poison
traits.text: An effect with this trait delivers a poison or deals poison damage. An item with this trait is poisonous and might cause an affliction.

ability.name: Shock Mind

traits.name: Enchantment
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the enchantment school of magic, typically involving mind control, emotion alteration, and other mental effects.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target’s mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

traits.name: Occult
traits.text:
This magic comes from the occult tradition, calling upon bizarre and ephemeral mysteries. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to occult magic.

ability.text: The grioth scout makes a Strike with a voidglass weapon. If the Strike hits, it deals an additional 4d6 mental damage, and the target must succeed at a DC 26 Will save (this has the incapacitation trait) or become confused for 1 round.
